00013 
00014 #ifndef ULIBDBG_TRACE_H
00015 #define ULIBDBG_TRACE_H 1
00016 
00017 #include <ulib/base/trace.h>
00018 
00019 #include <ulib/debug/macro.h>
00020 #include <ulib/debug/error_simulation.h>
00021 
00022 #define U_MANAGE_RETURN_VALUE(type,format) \
00023    type trace_return_type(type ret) { \
00024    void* ptr_value = USimulationError::checkForMatch(buffer_trace); \
00025    if (ptr_value) \
00026       ret = *(type*)ptr_value; \
00027    trace_return(format, ret); \
00028    return ret; }
00029 
00030 #define U_MANAGE_SYSRETURN_VALUE(type,format,error) \
00031    type trace_sysreturn_type(type ret) { \
00032    void* ptr_value = USimulationError::checkForMatch(buffer_syscall); \
00033    if (ptr_value) \
00034       ret = *(type*)ptr_value; \
00035    trace_sysreturn((error), format, ret); \
00036    return ret; }
00037 
00038 typedef void*       pvoid_t;
00039 typedef char*       pchar_t;
00040 typedef const char* pcchar_t;
00041 
00042 // typedef int (*x11error_t)  (void*, void*);
00043 // typedef int (*x11IOerror_t)(void*);
00044 
00045 class U_EXPORT UTrace {
00046 public:
00047 
00048         // Initialization and termination methods.
00049 
00050          UTrace(int level, const char* format, ...);
00051         ~UTrace();
00052 
00053         // trace return from generic call
00054 
00055         void trace_return(const char* format, ...);
00056 
00057         // manage return from generic call for tipology of value (of return)...
00058 
00059         U_MANAGE_RETURN_VALUE(bool,               "%b")
00060         U_MANAGE_RETURN_VALUE(char,               "%C")
00061         U_MANAGE_RETURN_VALUE(int,                "%d")
00062         U_MANAGE_RETURN_VALUE(unsigned int,       "%u")
00063         U_MANAGE_RETURN_VALUE(long,               "%ld")
00064         U_MANAGE_RETURN_VALUE(unsigned long,      "%lu")
00065         U_MANAGE_RETURN_VALUE(long long,          "%lld")
00066         U_MANAGE_RETURN_VALUE(unsigned long long, "%llu")
00067         U_MANAGE_RETURN_VALUE(float,              "%f")
00068         U_MANAGE_RETURN_VALUE(double,             "%g")
00069         U_MANAGE_RETURN_VALUE(long double,        "%LG")
00070         U_MANAGE_RETURN_VALUE(void*,              "%p")
00071         U_MANAGE_RETURN_VALUE(const void*,        "%p")
00072         U_MANAGE_RETURN_VALUE(char*,              "%S")
00073         U_MANAGE_RETURN_VALUE(const char*,        "%S")
00074         U_MANAGE_RETURN_VALUE(void**,             "%p")
00075         U_MANAGE_RETURN_VALUE(char**,             "%p")
00076 
00077         // trace call and return from system call
00078 
00079         void trace_syscall(              const char* format, ...);
00080         void trace_sysreturn(bool error, const char* format, ...);
00081 
00082         // manage return from system call for tipology of value (of return)...
00083 
00084         U_MANAGE_SYSRETURN_VALUE(int,           "%d",   ret == -1)
00085         U_MANAGE_SYSRETURN_VALUE(unsigned int,  "%u",   ret == 0U)
00086         U_MANAGE_SYSRETURN_VALUE(long,          "%ld",  ret == -1L)
00087         U_MANAGE_SYSRETURN_VALUE(unsigned long, "%lu",  ret == 0UL)
00088         U_MANAGE_SYSRETURN_VALUE(pvoid_t,       "%p",   ret ==  0 ||
00089                                                                                                                                         ret == (void*)-1)
00090         U_MANAGE_SYSRETURN_VALUE(pchar_t,       "%S",   ret ==  0)
00091         U_MANAGE_SYSRETURN_VALUE(pcchar_t,      "%S",   ret ==  0)
00092         U_MANAGE_SYSRETURN_VALUE(sighandler_t,  "%p",   ret == (sighandler_t) SIG_ERR)
00093 
00094 #if SIZEOF_OFF_T != SIZEOF_LONG
00095         U_MANAGE_SYSRETURN_VALUE(off_t,         "%I",   ret == -1LL)
00096 #elif SIZEOF_OFF_T == 4 
00097         U_MANAGE_SYSRETURN_VALUE(loff_t,        "%I",   ret == -1LL) /* Type of file sizes and offsets (LFS) */
00098 #endif
00099 
00100         // U_MANAGE_SYSRETURN_VALUE(x11error_t,   "%p", ret == (x11error_t) 0)
00101         // U_MANAGE_SYSRETURN_VALUE(x11IOerror_t, "%p", ret == (x11IOerror_t) 0)
00102 
00103         // Attivazione-disattivazione temporanea
00104 
00105         static void  resume() { u_trace_suspend(1); }
00106         static void suspend() { u_trace_suspend(0); }
00107 
00108 private:
00109         uint32_t buffer_trace_len, buffer_syscall_len;
00110         char buffer_trace[1019], buffer_syscall[1019];
00111         bool flag_syscall_read_or_write;
00112 public:
00113         bool active;
00114 };
00115 
00116 #endif
